docs.title: What is Nyroxis?
docs.text:
Nyroxis is a lightweight, AI-assisted cybersecurity platform designed to protect personal and unmanaged endpoints — the devices that traditional enterprise security tools often ignore.

It provides continuous, privacy-first monitoring of your device and helps you detect suspicious activity early, without requiring cloud connectivity or technical knowledge.

docs.title: Why Nyroxis Exists
docs.text:
Modern cyberattacks no longer target only companies. Executives, lawyers, doctors, journalists, and even families are targeted on their personal devices, where they have no SOC, no SIEM, and no security team watching over them.

Nyroxis fills this gap by bringing enterprise-grade visibility to the personal level — without the complexity.

docs.title: Who is Nyroxis For?
docs.text:
• Executives & high-profile individuals
  • Lawyers, doctors & professionals handling sensitive data
  • Families seeking digital safety visibility
  • Cybersecurity engineers & SOC analysts at home
  • Frequent travelers and remote workers

docs.title: How Nyroxis Works (High-Level)
docs.text: Nyroxis has two core components:

docs.title: Nyroxis Agent
docs.text:
• Quiet local monitoring
  • Collects important security events
  • Stores everything encrypted locally
  • Works fully offline
  • Tamper-resistant design

docs.title: Nyroxis Dashboard
docs.text:
• Clear logs and alerts
  • Security trends and insights
  • Behavioral analysis and AI scoring
  • Simple explanations for suspicious actions
[ Device ]
   |--> Nyroxis Agent
   |--> Nyroxis Dashboard

docs.title: Key Advantages
docs.text:
• Privacy-first encrypted storage
  • Offline by design
  • Lightweight
  • AI-assisted detection
  • User-friendly

docs.title: Documentation Guide
docs.text: This documentation includes: - Architecture - Agent & Dashboard - Security & privacy - Use cases - Roadmap - Licensing - FAQ & Glossary

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text: Nyroxis brings enterprise‑style visibility to personal and professional devices, while remaining lightweight, private, and fully offline‑capable. Below is a clear overview of the main features that define the Nyroxis platform.

docs.title: Local Event Monitoring
docs.text:
Nyroxis continuously collects essential security‑relevant activity such as: - Process creation and termination - Network connections - File modifications - Privilege‑related actions - System and security events

All monitoring happens locally, without sending data to the cloud.

docs.title: Encrypted Local Storage
docs.text:
All collected events are: - Encrypted at rest - Protected against tampering - Stored only on the user’s device

Nyroxis ensures that sensitive activity logs remain private and under user control.

docs.title: AI‑Assisted Behavioral Analysis
docs.text:
Nyroxis uses lightweight AI models to identify: - Suspicious behavioral patterns - Anomalous activity sequences - Early signs of compromise - Potential persistence mechanisms

The AI assists the user by prioritizing relevant events and reducing noise.

docs.title: Clear, Human‑Friendly Dashboard
docs.text:
The dashboard provides: - Real‑time event timeline - Visual charts and summaries - Severity indicators - Simple explanations of suspicious actions

Designed for both non‑technical users and cybersecurity professionals.

docs.title: Tamper‑Resistant Architecture
docs.text:
Nyroxis includes mechanisms that help protect: - The agent service - Local logs - Integrity of event data

This ensures attackers cannot easily erase their footprints.

docs.title: Offline‑First Operation
docs.text:
Nyroxis works fully without: - Cloud connection - Internet dependency - External authentication

The platform is designed for high‑privacy environments.

docs.title: Designed for Real People
docs.text:
Nyroxis fits naturally into: - Executive workstations - Lawyer and doctor laptops - Family computers - Cybersecurity home labs - Remote worker devices

It provides clarity and confidence without technical complexity.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Nyroxis is a privacy-first, lightweight cybersecurity platform designed to give individuals and professionals the same level of visibility and protection that enterprises receive — but without the complexity, cost, or cloud dependency.

In modern digital life, personal and unmanaged endpoints have become the weakest link. Laptops at home, personal workstations, and everyday devices carry sensitive information, yet they often lack structured monitoring or early-warning systems.

Nyroxis provides a clear, simple answer: local security intelligence, directly on the device, with encrypted storage and AI-assisted analysis.

docs.title: The Gap Nyroxis Solves
docs.text:
While organizations benefit from SOC teams, SIEM platforms, and 24/7 monitoring, individuals and small professional environments do not.

This creates a critical gap: - No visibility into what processes, connections, or actions occur on the device - No alerting when suspicious activity happens - No way to understand whether the system is being targeted - No unified security timeline for investigation

Nyroxis bridges this gap by offering a structured, intelligent, and offline-capable security layer.

docs.title: Our Approach
docs.text:
Nyroxis focuses on three core principles: - Local-first security — all logs remain on the device - Intelligent detection — behavior-aware AI assistance - Human-friendly visibility — clear dashboards and explanations

The result is a system that brings enterprise-grade awareness into a form suitable for families, professionals, executives, and cybersecurity practitioners.

docs.text:
This section introduces the core concepts behind Nyroxis and provides a structured high‑level understanding of the platform.

docs.title: Target Personas
docs.text: Nyroxis is designed for real people who need stronger protection than traditional consumer security tools can provide. Below are the primary personas the platform is built for.

docs.title: Executives & High-Profile Individuals
docs.text:
Executives and public figures are frequent targets of: - Credential theft - Social engineering - Targeted malware - Surveillance attempts

Nyroxis gives them local visibility into suspicious activity without relying on external cloud services.

docs.title: Lawyers, Doctors & Sensitive Professions
docs.text:
Professionals handling confidential data need: - Strong privacy - tamper-resistant event logging - early detection of anomalies

Nyroxis helps protect devices that store legal documents, medical files, contracts, and confidential communications.

docs.title: Families & Everyday Users
docs.text:
Families often lack tools that explain: - What is happening on their computer - Whether something suspicious is occurring - What risks exist for children and teenagers

Nyroxis provides simple visibility and peace of mind.

docs.title: Cybersecurity Enthusiasts & SOC Analysts at Home
docs.text:
Experts want: - A personal SIEM-style timeline - Behavioral insights - Local encrypted logging - No cloud dependencies

Nyroxis gives them a structured environment for monitoring their own devices.

docs.title: Remote Workers & Frequent Travelers
docs.text:
Travelers and remote professionals face: - Untrusted networks - Increased exposure - High risk of credential theft

Nyroxis offers a portable, reliable, offline-first security layer that travels with the user.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis is built for anyone who needs clarity and protection at the personal level — from families to high‑profile professionals, and from remote workers to cybersecurity practitioners.

docs.title: Problem & Context
docs.text: Cybersecurity has evolved, but personal protection has not. While enterprises use SOC teams, SIEM platforms, and advanced monitoring, individuals and small professional environments remain exposed.

docs.title: Personal Endpoints Are Now Prime Targets
docs.text:
Attackers increasingly target: - Executives and high-profile individuals - Lawyers, doctors, and professionals with sensitive data - Families and children - Remote workers and travelers

These devices often contain: - Private communications - Financial information - Legal or medical data - Access to corporate accounts - Personal photos and documents

Yet they lack any structured monitoring.

docs.title: Lack of Visibility = Increased Risk
docs.text:
Most users cannot see: - What processes are running - What connects to the internet - What files are modified - Whether malware or persistence exists - If someone is spying on them

Without visibility, attacks remain unnoticed until it's too late.

docs.title: Why Traditional Tools Are Not Enough
docs.text:
Antivirus tools focus on signature-based detection. But modern threats rely on: - Living-off-the-land techniques - Slow and stealthy behavioral patterns - Fileless attacks - Credential theft - Local privilege escalation

These techniques require behavioral visibility, not just scanning.

docs.title: The Core Problem
docs.text:
There is no personal-level visibility layer equivalent to enterprise SIEM.

Nyroxis fills this gap by providing: - Local monitoring - Encrypted event storage - Behavioral and AI-assisted analysis - A clear dashboard for human understanding

All without cloud dependency or technical complexity.

docs.title: Value Proposition
docs.text:
Nyroxis delivers a new category of personal cybersecurity: enterprise‑grade visibility, without enterprise complexity.

Unlike traditional antivirus tools, Nyroxis provides ongoing situational awareness — helping users understand what is happening on their device at any moment, with clear insights and encrypted local storage.

docs.title: Why Nyroxis Is Different
docs.text:
Most security tools fall into two extremes: - Too simple (consumer antivirus) → limited visibility, signature-based - Too complex (corporate SIEM/SOC) → heavy, expensive, cloud‑dependent

Nyroxis is designed specifically for the middle ground: - Lightweight - Privacy-first - AI‑assisted - Offline‑capable - Human-friendly

It brings professional‑level monitoring into a format suitable for individuals and small professional environments.

docs.title: ✔ Local Visibility
docs.text: Nyroxis shows what processes, connections, and changes occur — information normally hidden from users.

docs.title: ✔ Early Detection
docs.text: Behavioral analysis and AI scoring help identify suspicious patterns early, before they escalate.

docs.title: ✔ Full Local Encryption
docs.text: All logs and events are encrypted and stored locally. No cloud storage. No third‑party access.

docs.title: ✔ Intelligent Insights (Not Noise)
docs.text: Nyroxis reduces noise and highlights events that actually matter, with clear explanations.

docs.title: ✔ Simple for Non‑Experts
docs.text: Complex security concepts are translated into simple language: - What happened - Why it matters - What you can do

docs.title: ✔ Designed for Families & Professionals
docs.text: Nyroxis fits: - Executive devices - Lawyer/doctor laptops - Cybersecurity home labs - Remote workers - Family computers

docs.title: The Promise of Nyroxis
docs.text:
Security that protects people, not just systems.

With Nyroxis, users gain clarity, confidence, and control over their digital environment — without sacrificing privacy or performance.

docs.title: Vision
docs.text:
Nyroxis was created with a clear mission: to bring enterprise‑level security awareness to individuals, families, and independent professionals — without sacrificing privacy or usability.

Modern digital life demands protection that is: - Always available - Lightweight and private - Understandable even without technical expertise - Capable of detecting subtle, behavioral threats

Nyroxis follows a long‑term vision built on these principles.

docs.title: A World Where Personal Devices Are Not Blind Spots
docs.text: Most cyber defense technologies are built for companies, not people. Nyroxis envisions a future where: - Every person has visibility into their own device - Security insights are simple and actionable - Breaches are detected early - Sensitive professions (law, medicine, journalism) have personal‑grade protection - Families can stay digitally safe without relying on cloud platforms

docs.title: Privacy‑First by Design
docs.text:
Nyroxis believes privacy is a fundamental right. Our vision is to deliver strong security without data extraction, meaning: - Logs remain local - Encryption is default - Nothing leaves the device unless the user chooses - No cloud dependency

Security must empower the user — never compromise their privacy.

docs.title: Intelligence That Works for the User
docs.text:
AI should clarify, not complicate. Nyroxis aims to provide: - Behavioral analysis - Risk scoring - Simple explanations (“what happened” and “why it matters”)

so that anyone can understand potential threats.

docs.title: Long‑Term Direction
docs.text:
Nyroxis is evolving toward: - Adaptive behavioral models - Cross‑device security insights (optional, local-sync) - Extended correlation packs - Multi-platform agent support - Advanced dashboards for both families and professionals

The goal is simple: make personal cybersecurity intelligent, accessible, and trustworthy.

docs.title: Architecture Components
docs.text: This section describes each major component of the Nyroxis ecosystem. All components are designed to operate locally, efficiently, and with a privacy‑first approach.

docs.title: 1. Nyroxis Agent
docs.text: The core monitoring service running on the device.

docs.title: Responsibilities
docs.text:
• Collects system and security events
  • Monitors processes, network activity, file access, and privilege actions
  • Ensures logs are encrypted immediately
  • Maintains tamper‑resistant integrity

docs.title: Properties
docs.text:
• Lightweight (minimal CPU and RAM usage)
  • Offline‑first
  • Runs silently in the background

docs.title: 2. Local Encrypted Database
docs.text: Nyroxis uses a secured, encrypted datastore to retain all collected events.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Full at‑rest encryption
  • Structured event storage
  • Integrity protection (anti‑tamper design)
  • Optimized for fast lookups and timeline building

No cloud upload is performed — the user remains the sole owner of the data.

docs.title: 3. Nyroxis Dashboard
docs.text: A visual interface that transforms raw security data into something understandable.

docs.title: Provides
docs.text:
• Log viewer with filtering and search
  • Charts, severity indicators, daily summaries
  • Correlation and event grouping
  • Human‑readable explanations of suspicious actions

docs.title: Audience
docs.text: Both non‑technical users and cybersecurity professionals can use it effectively.

docs.title: 4. Local Analysis Engine
docs.text: A lightweight engine responsible for intelligence and detection.

docs.title: Functions
docs.text:
• Behavioral heuristics
  • AI‑assisted scoring
  • Event correlation
  • Suspicious pattern detection

Everything operates locally to preserve user privacy.

docs.title: 5. Licensing & Verification (Local‑First)
docs.text: Nyroxis can validate a license securely without exposing personal logs.

docs.title: Key Points
docs.text:
• Only minimal metadata is exchanged when required
  • No event data or logs are ever uploaded
  • Licensing integrity is maintained even offline

docs.title: 6. Optional Integrations (Future‑Ready)
docs.text:
Nyroxis is designed to support optional add‑ons without compromising privacy.

Potential future modules: - Local‑sync between trusted devices - Encrypted backup (user‑initiated only) - Additional correlation packs

These remain optional and always privacy‑safe.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis is built from modular, local‑first components that work together to give users enterprise‑grade visibility — privately, simply, and efficiently.

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
This section explains how data moves inside Nyroxis — from event collection to user interpretation — while remaining fully local, encrypted, and private.

Nyroxis follows a simple, transparent, privacy-first lifecycle.

docs.title: 1. Event Collection
docs.text:
The Nyroxis Agent continuously monitors: - Processes - Network connections - File changes - Privilege actions - System & security events

All data is collected locally, without any cloud interaction.

docs.title: 2. Encryption at Source
docs.text:
Immediately after collection: - Events are encrypted - Integrity protections are applied - Data becomes tamper-resistant

This ensures logs cannot be altered or read by attackers.

docs.title: 3. Local Encrypted Database
docs.text:
Encrypted events are stored inside a secure, local datastore.

Properties: - Fully encrypted at rest - Structured for fast lookups - Optimized for timeline reconstruction - No external transmission ever occurs

The database never leaves the device.

docs.title: 4. Local Analysis Engine
docs.text:
The analysis engine processes encrypted data locally to generate: - Behavioral insights - Anomaly detection - AI-assisted scoring - Correlation between events

No external servers or cloud services are involved.

docs.title: 5. Dashboard Visualization
docs.text:
The Nyroxis Dashboard transforms technical data into: - Logs - Alerts - Charts & trends - Severity indicators - Explanations in simple language

Everything remains local and private.

docs.title: Full Data Lifecycle Diagram
docs.text:
[ System Events ] 
        ↓
[ Nyroxis Agent ]
        ↓ (encrypted)
[ Local Encrypted Database ]
        ↓
[ Local Analysis Engine ]
        ↓
[ Nyroxis Dashboard ]

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis maintains a strictly local, encrypted, and privacy-first data flow — giving users visibility without exposing their information to the cloud or third parties.

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text: Nyroxis is built on a lightweight, privacy‑first architecture designed to deliver enterprise‑grade visibility without relying on the cloud. The system runs fully on the user’s device and is composed of clear, independent components that work together securely.

docs.title: Core Components
docs.text: Nyroxis consists of the following high-level modules:

docs.title: 1. Nyroxis Agent
docs.text: A lightweight endpoint monitor that: - Collects security‑relevant events - Encrypts and stores them locally - Ensures tamper‑resistant data integrity - Operates 100% offline

docs.title: 2. Encrypted Local Database
docs.text: All collected events are stored in: - A secured local datastore - Fully encrypted at rest - Structured for fast analysis and timeline reconstruction

docs.title: 3. Nyroxis Dashboard
docs.text: A clean and intuitive interface that: - Displays logs, alerts, and correlations - Generates charts and timelines - Provides explanations and severity indicators - Helps both experts and non‑technical users

docs.title: 4. Local Analysis Engine
docs.text: Nyroxis includes: - Lightweight behavioral heuristics - AI‑assisted scoring - Event correlation logic All processing happens locally, ensuring privacy.

docs.title: 5. Optional Licensing Validation (Local‑First)
docs.text: Nyroxis can validate license integrity without sending event data. Only minimal metadata (if required by the user) is exchanged — never logs.

docs.title: High-Level Data Flow
docs.text:
The architecture follows a simple, transparent lifecycle:

[ System Events ]  
        ↓  
[ Nyroxis Agent ]  
        ↓ (encrypted)
[ Local Encrypted Database ]  
        ↓  
[ Local Analysis Engine ]  
        ↓  
[ Nyroxis Dashboard ]

At no stage are logs or sensitive data uploaded to external servers.

docs.title: Privacy by Design
docs.text:
• No cloud ingestion
  • Local encryption
  • User retains full control

docs.title: Simplicity & Clarity
docs.text:
• Clean architecture
  • Easy to understand
  • Suitable for families, professionals, and experts

docs.title: Lightweight Operation
docs.text: Built to run smoothly even on older laptops and home devices.

docs.title: Offline‑First Security
docs.text: No internet connection is required for: - Monitoring - Analysis - Dashboard usage - Event correlation

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis provides a modern, minimalistic, and secure architecture that brings professional‑grade visibility to personal devices — entirely offline and with full respect for user privacy.

docs.title: Nyroxis Agent — Overview
docs.text: The Nyroxis Agent is the core monitoring component of the platform. It runs locally on the user’s device, quietly collecting essential security events while maintaining full privacy and minimal resource usage.

docs.title: What the Agent Does
docs.text:
The Agent continuously observes system activity and builds a structured security timeline.

It monitors: - Process creation & termination - Network connections - File modifications - Privilege actions - System and security events

All events are collected privately and locally.

docs.title: Privacy-First Operation
docs.text:
The Agent never uploads logs or sends event data to external servers. Everything remains on the device and is:

  • Encrypted at the moment of collection
  • Protected against tampering
  • Stored in a secure local database

docs.title: Lightweight by Design
docs.text:
The Agent is optimized for: - Low CPU usage - Minimal RAM footprint - Silent background operation - Reliability even on older laptops

This makes Nyroxis suitable for families, professionals, and high-security environments.

docs.title: Resilient & Tamper-Aware
docs.text: The Agent incorporates protective mechanisms to ensure: - Collected event data cannot be altered - Attackers cannot easily cover their tracks - System integrity remains trustworthy

docs.title: Works Completely Offline
docs.text:
No internet connection is required for: - Monitoring - Encryption - Data storage - Analysis

Nyroxis is fully functional even in isolated or high-privacy environments.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: The Nyroxis Agent delivers continuous, encrypted, offline monitoring — giving users enterprise-grade visibility without exposing their data to third parties.

docs.title: Event Collector
docs.text: The Event Collector is the subsystem inside the Nyroxis Agent responsible for capturing all security‑relevant activity on the device. It is designed to be lightweight, private, and fully offline, while providing enterprise‑grade visibility into endpoint behavior.

docs.title: Purpose of the Event Collector
docs.text:
The Event Collector’s main goal is to gather actionable, structured information that helps users understand: - What is happening on their device - When events occur - Whether activity is normal or suspicious

All without exposing data externally.

docs.title: What the Event Collector Monitors
docs.text: Nyroxis focuses on the most security‑critical categories of events:

docs.title: 1. Process Events
docs.text:
• Process creation
  • Process termination
  • Parent/child relationships
  • Command-line parameters (where available)

docs.title: 2. Network Events
docs.text:
• Outgoing connections
  • Incoming connections
  • Destination IPs, ports
  • Protocol type
  • Suspicious repeated attempts

docs.title: 3. File System Activity
docs.text:
• File creation
  • File deletion
  • Modifications
  • Access to sensitive directories

docs.title: 4. Privilege & Security Events
docs.text:
• Elevation attempts
  • Sensitive system calls
  • Registry/config changes (on supported platforms)
  • Access to protected resources

docs.title: 5. System & Kernel-Level Events
docs.text:
• Service start/stop
  • Driver loading
  • System warnings
  • Indicators of persistence mechanisms

The exact scope is optimized per operating system.

docs.title: Secure Collection & Immediate Encryption
docs.text:
Every event gathered by the collector is: - Encrypted instantly - Stored in tamper‑resistant form - Indexed with timestamps and metadata

No unencrypted logs are ever written to disk.

docs.title: ️ Lightweight Implementation
docs.text:
The Event Collector is optimized for: - Minimal CPU overhead - Low memory usage - Zero impact on everyday tasks - Stable operation over long periods

This ensures Nyroxis remains suitable for home and professional environments.

docs.title: Anti‑Tamper Protections
docs.text:
To ensure collected logs cannot be altered or erased: - Integrity checks are applied - Secure write‑paths are enforced - Critical files are monitored for unauthorized changes

This increases trustworthiness during investigations.

docs.title: Offline‑First by Design
docs.text: The Event Collector operates with zero cloud interaction. All monitoring, encryption, and storage happen locally — preserving user privacy even in sensitive environments.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: The Event Collector is the foundation of Nyroxis’ visibility layer, capturing every important security‑related activity while staying lightweight, encrypted, and completely offline.

docs.title: Protection Core
docs.text:
The Protection Core is the security backbone of the Nyroxis Agent. It reinforces the integrity of monitoring, ensures encrypted event handling, and prevents attackers from tampering with logs or disabling the Agent.

Its design follows strict privacy-first and offline-first principles.

docs.title: Core Objectives
docs.text:
The Protection Core ensures: - Security events cannot be altered - Logs remain encrypted from source to storage - The Agent cannot be silently disabled - Sensitive components are protected from unauthorized changes

This creates trust in the visibility layer.

docs.title: 1. End-to-End Local Encryption
docs.text:
Every event captured by Nyroxis is: - Encrypted immediately - Written to disk in encrypted form only - Indexed with timestamps and metadata - Never stored in plaintext

The encryption model prevents attackers from reading or modifying event history.

docs.title: 2. Integrity Protection (Anti-Tamper)
docs.text:
Nyroxis applies mechanisms such as: - Protected write paths - Hashing & verification of event blocks - Monitoring of its own critical files - Alerting on suspicious modification attempts

These components help detect attempts to erase traces.

docs.title: 3. Agent Self-Protection
docs.text:
The Protection Core ensures the Agent cannot be quietly disabled.

Protections include: - Monitoring the Agent’s runtime state - Detecting unexpected shutdowns - Ensuring immediate restart on interruption - Logging shutdown attempts as security events

This ensures persistent monitoring even under attack.

docs.title: 4. Offline Security
docs.text:
The Protection Core never requires: - Cloud validation - External APIs - Remote servers

All checks and verification happen 100% offline.

docs.title: 5. Secure Interaction with the Dashboard
docs.text:
The Dashboard accesses data through: - Verified secure read-paths - Read-only access to logs - Strict separation between visualization and event storage

This prevents UI-layer attacks from modifying real data.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: The Protection Core ensures that monitoring, encryption, and event integrity remain trustworthy — even in hostile environments — while keeping all data private and fully local.

docs.title: Charts & Analytics
docs.text: The Charts & Analytics section of the Nyroxis Dashboard transforms raw security events into visual insights, helping users quickly understand trends, anomalies, and potential risks. All analytics are generated locally, preserving full privacy.

docs.title: Purpose of Visual Analytics
docs.text:
Charts help users answer key questions immediately: - Is activity increasing or decreasing over time? - Are there unusual spikes in processes or network traffic? - Which event categories occur the most? - Are there recurring suspicious patterns?

Visuals make complex data simple to understand.

docs.title: 1. Event Frequency Over Time
docs.text:
Shows how many events occur: - Hourly - Daily - Weekly

Useful for spotting spikes, bursts of activity, or unexpected quiet periods.

docs.title: 2. Top Event Sources
docs.text:
Highlights which processes, files, or network endpoints generate the most events.

Examples: - Most active processes - Most accessed files - Most frequent network connections

docs.title: 3. Severity Trend
docs.text:
Tracks the evolution of: - Informational events - Warnings - High-risk or critical activity

Helps users detect escalation before a compromise occurs.

docs.title: 4. Special Security Indicators
docs.text:
Nyroxis provides dedicated charts for high-value signals: - Suspicious process chains - Repeated failed connections - Access to sensitive locations - Privilege-related events

These visuals help identify early signs of malicious behavior.

docs.title: Local Analytics Engine
docs.text:
All charts are powered by the local analysis engine: - No cloud - No external APIs - All computation stays on the device

Charts are generated directly from the encrypted local database.

docs.title: ️  Interactivity
docs.text:
Charts support: - Hover details - Zooming (optional) - Filtering by time range - Category selection

Designed for both simple and advanced usage.

docs.title: Privacy & Offline Operation
docs.text: Nothing is sent to external services — ever. Analytics are computed and rendered locally from encrypted events.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Charts & Analytics provide a visual, privacy-preserving way to understand system activity, detect anomalies, and gain immediate insights into device security.

docs.title: Logs & Search
docs.text: The Logs section of the Nyroxis Dashboard provides a clear, searchable, and structured view of all security‑relevant events collected by the Nyroxis Agent. It is designed to give both non‑technical users and professionals instant visibility into what is happening on their device.

docs.title: Purpose of Logs View
docs.text:
The Logs module helps users understand: - What events occurred - When they happened - Which processes, files, or network connections were involved - Whether the activity appears normal or suspicious

It turns raw system data into readable, timestamped entries.

docs.title: Event Categories
docs.text: Nyroxis organizes logs into intuitive groups:

docs.title: 1. Process Events
docs.text:
• Process start / stop
  • Parent / child relationships
  • Execution paths

docs.title: 2. Network Events
docs.text:
• Outgoing / incoming connections
  • IP / port details
  • Protocol types

docs.title: 3. File System Events
docs.text:
• Creation
  • Deletion
  • Modification
  • Sensitive file access

docs.title: 4. Privilege & Security Events
docs.text:
• Elevation attempts
  • Access to restricted resources
  • System policy changes

docs.title: 5. System Activity
docs.text:
• Services
  • Drivers
  • Kernel‑related behaviors

docs.title: Search & Filtering
docs.text: The Logs interface includes a powerful filtering panel:

docs.title: Available filters
docs.text:
• Date & time range
  • Event category
  • Severity level
  • Process name
  • File path
  • Network endpoint
  • Keywords

docs.title: Search capabilities
docs.text:
• Real‑time filtering
  • Regex‑friendly (optional)
  • Multi‑field search
  • Instant refresh

Designed to support both beginners and analysts.

docs.title: Event Details Panel
docs.text: Clicking an event opens a details card displaying: - Full metadata - Process lineage - Related files or connections - Severity score - Explanation of risk - Recommendations (if applicable)

docs.title: Privacy & Offline‑First
docs.text:
All logs: - Are stored locally - Are fully encrypted - Never leave the device - Are processed without cloud interaction

Nyroxis ensures that users retain full control over their event data.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: The Logs & Search module provides a transparent, organized, and fully private way to explore system activity — giving users true visibility without exposing any data externally.

docs.title: Rule Matching
docs.text: The Rule Matching module allows Nyroxis to highlight events that match predefined security rules. It brings SIEM-style logic to personal devices — fully offline and privacy-first.

docs.title: What Rule Matching Does
docs.text:
Nyroxis evaluates events against a set of local rules to identify: - Suspicious behaviors - Repeated anomalous patterns - High-risk combinations of events - Indicators of compromise (IoCs)

No rules or logs are ever sent online.

docs.title: 1. Threshold-Based Rules
docs.text: Trigger when something happens too often in a short time: - Multiple failed network connections - Repeated privilege elevation attempts - Excessive file modifications

docs.title: 2. Sequence Rules
docs.text: Detect harmful event chains: - Process → network → persistence - Script execution → system modification - Unknown process → sensitive file access

docs.title: 3. Time-Window Rules
docs.text: Identify patterns only visible over time: - Gradual privilege escalation - Slow lateral movement - Hourly failed connections

docs.title: 4. Entity-Specific Rules
docs.text: Target activity involving: - A specific file path - A specific process - A specific registry/config entry

docs.title: How Nyroxis Evaluates Rules
docs.text:
The engine matches rules against: - Event metadata - Timestamps - Process lineage - Network endpoints - Severity indicators

Evaluations are real-time and fully local.

docs.title: Rule Hit Details
docs.text: When a rule is triggered, Nyroxis provides: - A clear explanation - Involved events - Severity level - Recommended actions - Context panel with supporting details

docs.title: Privacy Guarantee
docs.text: All rule matching: - Happens locally - Does not communicate with external services - Uses encrypted event data only - Never uploads logs or pattern matches

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Rule Matching brings structured, SIEM-like detection to personal endpoints — but without cloud dependency or loss of privacy.

docs.title: Dashboard UI Design
docs.text: The Nyroxis Dashboard is built to give users—both non-technical and professional—a clear, intuitive, and actionable view of their device’s security state. Its design follows principles of clarity, minimalism, privacy, and real-time awareness.

docs.title: 1. Clarity Above Complexity
docs.text: Security data should never overwhelm the user. The Dashboard transforms raw logs into readable insights with: - Clean typography - Clear spacing - Icon-based cues - Color‑coded severity indicators

docs.title: 2. Privacy-First Visualization
docs.text: All data shown in the Dashboard: - Comes from local encrypted storage - Never leaves the device - Is processed entirely offline

docs.title: 3. Consistent UX for All Personas
docs.text:
The interface supports: - Families - Professionals - Executives - Cybersecurity analysts

Each user receives the same clean, structured layout.

docs.title: 1. Header Bar
docs.text:
Contains: - App identity (Nyroxis brand) - Navigation tabs - Settings & language options

Consistently visible across all pages.

docs.title: 2. Left Navigation Panel
docs.text:
Organized for clarity:

  • Events & Search
  • Detections
  • Correlations
  • Scenarios
  • AI Nyroxis (NyXIA)
  • Reports
  • Severity Manager
  • Rule Matching Builder
  • Settings
  • Help / Documentation
  • About Nyroxis

Each section reflects a functional capability.

docs.title: 3. Main Workspace
docs.text:
This is the active view where users interact with:

  • Timelines
  • Event tables
  • Context panels
  • Visual charts
  • Rule editors

Designed with a three-column logic when possible: 1. Filters 2. Primary content 3. Details/explanations

docs.title: 4. Footer / Status Line
docs.text: Shows minimal, non-intrusive information: - Agent status - Last sync with local DB - Resource usage (optional)

docs.title: Colors
docs.text:
• Blue / Cyan: informational
  • Amber / Yellow: warnings
  • Red: critical severity
  • Green: safe/normal

Lightweight gradients may be used to avoid a flat, dull look.

docs.title: Typography
docs.text: Readable, modern fonts: - Semi-rounded - Medium thickness - Clear hierarchy (H1, H2, H3)

docs.title: Icons & Visual Indicators
docs.text: Simple, neutral icons that enhance understanding without clutter.

docs.title: Responsiveness
docs.text:
The Dashboard is optimized first for desktops/laptops, but scales down across: - 13” laptops - High-resolution screens - Ultra-wide monitors

Touch-friendly behavior is optional.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: The Nyroxis Dashboard UI focuses on clarity, privacy, and usability—ensuring all users can quickly understand their system’s security status without technical knowledge.

docs.title: AI Engine — Internal Mechanics
docs.text: The Nyroxis AI Engine (NyXIA) is designed to run fully locally, performing intelligent analysis on encrypted security events without relying on cloud services. This document explains the internal mechanics in a simple, semi-technical way suitable for both users and investors.

docs.title: Core Design Principles
docs.text: NyXIA is built on four foundational principles:

docs.title: 1. Privacy‑First
docs.text:
• No cloud processing
  • No external APIs
  • No data sharing All intelligence runs on the user’s own device.

docs.title: 2. Lightweight AI
docs.text: Models are optimized for: - Low CPU usage - Minimal memory - Real-time execution

docs.title: 3. Behavioral Understanding
docs.text: Instead of analyzing logs individually, NyXIA understands patterns that occur across time.

docs.title: 4. Fully Offline Operation
docs.text: All analysis, learning, and decision-making happen locally.

docs.title: 1. Event Intake
docs.text: Nyroxis Agent collects: - Process events - Network events - File system changes - Privilege-related actions All encrypted before reaching NyXIA.

docs.title: 2. Sequence Builder
docs.text:
Events are grouped into short windows: 

w(t) = {event_t, event_t+1, ..., event_t+k}
This allows the AI to detect multi-step behavior.

docs.title: 3. Feature Extraction
docs.text: For each window, NyXIA extracts lightweight features: - Process lineage - Network entropy - File access patterns - Timing irregularities - Behavioral deltas

docs.title: 4. Local Model Inference
docs.text:
NyXIA evaluates: - Anomaly scores - Behavior class - Deviation from normal profile - Likelihood of malicious activity

All computations stay on-device.

docs.title: 5. Scenario Mapping
docs.text: The engine correlates detections to larger scenarios such as: - Persistence attempts - Unauthorized network activity - Privilege escalation attempts - Multi-stage intrusion

docs.title: Local Behavioral Baseline
docs.text:
NyXIA builds a private baseline of: - Normal processes - Typical connection patterns - Expected file activity - Usual time-of-day behavior

The baseline is: - Stored locally - Fully encrypted - Resettable by the user

No usage profile ever leaves the device.

docs.title: Safe-by-Design AI
docs.text:
NyXIA explicitly avoids: - User tracking - Cloud training - Personal data storage - Remote telemetry

The AI belongs to the user — not to the server.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: The AI Engine combines privacy-first design with intelligent behavioral detection. It processes encrypted system events locally, identifies risky patterns, and provides real‑world security insight — all without cloud dependence.

docs.title: AI Engine (NyXIA) — Overview
docs.text: NyXIA is the local AI engine inside Nyroxis, designed to analyze security events without sending any data to the cloud. It brings intelligent behavioral detection to personal and professional devices while preserving privacy and operating fully offline.

docs.title: Purpose of NyXIA
docs.text:
NyXIA provides: - Behavioral analysis of events - Detection of unusual or suspicious patterns - Local anomaly detection - Lightweight on-device inference - Zero data sharing outside the device

It is engineered to enhance visibility without compromising privacy.

docs.title: How NyXIA Works
docs.text:
NyXIA processes: - Process sequences - Network behaviors - File activity - Privilege actions - Time-based patterns

Instead of analyzing each event independently, NyXIA groups short sequences of activity to reveal hidden behaviors.

This makes it capable of detecting: - Slow attacks - Multi-step intrusions - Persistence techniques - Lateral movement indicators

docs.title: 1. Sequence-Based Analysis
docs.text: NyXIA evaluates windows of events rather than single entries. This helps identify suspicious behavior chains that traditional tools may miss.

docs.title: 2. Local Behavioral Profiles
docs.text:
NyXIA maintains a private behavioral baseline for each device: - Normal daily patterns - Usual processes - Typical network endpoints

Deviations are flagged as anomalies.

All baselines are stored locally and encrypted.

docs.title: 3. Lightweight AI Models
docs.text:
Models are optimized for: - Low CPU impact - On-device processing - Minimal memory use

Perfect for laptops, home devices, and sensitive environments.

docs.title: 4. No Cloud, No Uploads, No Tracking
docs.text:
NyXIA never: - Sends data to servers - Uploads event logs - Uses online AI APIs ( Optional )

Everything is computed locally and encrypted.

docs.title: Full Privacy Guarantee
docs.text:
NyXIA respects full user privacy by design: - Offline-only - Encrypted input/output - Local inference - No telemetry

The AI engine belongs entirely to the user’s device.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: NyXIA brings intelligent, privacy‑preserving behavioral detection to Nyroxis — offering real security insights without cloud dependency or data exposure.

docs.title: AI Detections
docs.text: The AI Detections module shows insights produced by NyXIA — the local AI engine — when it identifies unusual or suspicious activity on the device. All detections are generated locally, without cloud processing or data sharing.

docs.title: Purpose of AI Detections
docs.text:
NyXIA detects: - Behavioral anomalies - Suspicious event sequences - Rare or unexpected patterns - Indicators of compromise (IoCs) - High-risk deviations from the device’s normal profile

These detections help users see threats early.

docs.title: 1. Anomaly-Based Detections
docs.text:
Triggered when behavior significantly deviates from the usual device baseline.

Example cases: - Unusual process activity - Irregular network connections - Unexpected file modifications - Activity outside typical time periods

docs.title: 2. Behavioral Sequence Alerts
docs.text: NyXIA examines short windows of events to detect: - Multi-step intrusion attempts - Script + privilege escalation sequences - Process chains indicative of malware

docs.title: 3. Rare Event Patterns
docs.text: Highlighted when: - A process behaves differently than normal - A new rare endpoint appears - Activity resembles early-stage compromise

docs.title: 4. Persistent Suspicious Behavior
docs.text: Long-term anomalies, such as: - Repeated failed connections - Slow privilege escalation - Unusual background activity

docs.title: Detection Details
docs.text:
Each AI detection includes: - Description of the anomaly - Affected processes or paths - Related network activity - Severity rating - Contextual explanation - Recommendations (if enabled)

Nyroxis ensures these insights remain understandable for non-technical users.

docs.title: 100% Local & Private
docs.text:
All AI detections are: - Computed offline - Stored locally - Derived from encrypted logs - Never uploaded to servers

Your data never leaves your device.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: AI Detections provide intelligent, privacy-preserving alerts that help users identify dangerous or abnormal activity early — with full local processing and no cloud dependency.

docs.title: AI Scenarios
docs.text: AI Scenarios represent predefined, high-level security situations that NyXIA is capable of detecting based on behavioral patterns, sequences, and anomalies. They help users understand context, not just individual events.

docs.title: Purpose of AI Scenarios
docs.text:
While detections highlight specific anomalies, Scenarios explain why those anomalies matter by grouping signals into meaningful categories.

Scenarios give users clarity about: - The type of threat - The probable cause - How events are related - What the risk means in real-world terms

This helps even non-technical users understand what is happening.

docs.title: 1. Suspicious Process Chain
docs.text:
Detected when a process chain resembles known malicious behavior: - Unknown process → script engine - Script engine → modification → network call - Process spawning multiple children rapidly

Useful for catching early-stage malware or scripts.

docs.title: 2. Unauthorized Network Activity
docs.text:
Triggered when NyXIA observes: - Outbound connections to unknown or rare endpoints - Repeated failed connections - High-volume network activity outside normal patterns

May indicate scanning, beaconing, or data exfiltration attempts.

docs.title: 3. Abnormal File Activity
docs.text:
Occurs when: - Sensitive files are accessed unexpectedly - Many files change in a short window - Modifications align with suspicious process behavior

Useful for detecting ransomware-like behavior or tampering.

docs.title: 4. Privilege Escalation Attempt
docs.text:
Triggered by: - Repeated privilege actions - Rare or unusual system calls - Behavior inconsistent with normal user activity

This helps identify local exploitation attempts.

docs.title: 5. Persistence Indicator
docs.text:
Occurs when a process tries to: - Modify startup locations - Create scheduled tasks - Alter system configuration to survive reboot

This scenario warns about long-term compromise attempts.

docs.title: 6. Slow Intrusion Pattern
docs.text:
NyXIA identifies long-term anomalies such as: - Gradual escalation - Rare periodic activity - Multi-stage behavior spread over hours/days

This detects stealthy attackers that evade traditional tools.

docs.title: Scenario Report Details
docs.text: Each scenario provides: - Description of the situation - Affected events - Sequence explanation - Severity level - Real-world interpretation - Recommended next steps

docs.title: Fully Local Interpretation
docs.text: All scenario logic: - Runs offline - Uses encrypted log data - Never contacts cloud services - Preserves user privacy

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: AI Scenarios help users see the bigger picture, giving meaning to individual anomalies and enabling early detection of sophisticated threats — all fully offline and private.

docs.title: Secure Data Storage
docs.text: Nyroxis stores only the minimum amount of data required to provide security insights — and all stored data is fully encrypted, local, and tamper-resistant. This ensures privacy for individuals, families, and professionals who rely on Nyroxis for real protection without exposure.

docs.title: What Nyroxis Stores
docs.text: Nyroxis keeps only security‑relevant information, such as:

docs.title: 1. Event Logs
docs.text: Encrypted entries for: - Process activity - Network connections - File changes - Privilege actions - System behavior

docs.title: 2. Metadata for Analysis
docs.text: Lightweight metadata needed for: - AI behavioral detection - Rule matching - Correlation building

docs.title: 3. Local Behavioral Baseline
docs.text: Created by NyXIA: - Typical processes - Usual network endpoints - Normal activity windows Stored locally and encrypted.

docs.title: What Nyroxis Does Not Store
docs.text:
Nyroxis deliberately avoids collecting or saving personal or sensitive content.

It does NOT store: - Personal documents - Images or videos - Browser history - Location data - Passwords or credentials - Contents of files - User messages or emails

Only security‑oriented technical data is retained.

docs.title: Encryption Model
docs.text:
All stored data is: - Encrypted at the moment of capture - Saved only in encrypted form - Never written in plaintext - Decrypted only in memory during read

Encryption keys are: - Local to the device - Dynamically generated - Never embedded inside the app - Not transmitted to servers

docs.title: Tamper-Resistant Structures
docs.text:
Nyroxis uses: - Hash‑chained event blocks - Integrity verification - Protected write paths - Anti‑tamper checks during reads

This prevents attackers from modifying or wiping event history.

docs.title: Data Retention Lifetime
docs.text:
Nyroxis keeps logs only as long as needed for: - Visibility - Detection - Correlation

Users may: - Reset logs - Clear history - Export encrypted backups (optional in future versions)

docs.title: Fully Local Storage
docs.text:
All storage is: - Local-only - Offline - Encrypted - Zero cloud upload

Your security data stays on your machine — always.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis stores only encrypted, minimal, security‑focused information — never personal content — ensuring real privacy and protection for every user.

docs.title: Offline Mode
docs.text: Nyroxis is built from the ground up to operate fully offline — without requiring cloud access, remote authentication, or external APIs. This design gives users security, privacy, and full autonomy over their device.

docs.title: Why Offline Matters
docs.text:
Operating offline ensures: - No data leaves the device - No exposure to cloud breaches - No dependency on external infrastructure - No risk of third-party monitoring

Users retain complete control over their security data.

docs.title: 1. Full Local Operation
docs.text:
Nyroxis performs: - Event collection - Encryption - Storage - AI analysis - Rule matching - Correlations - Alerts

All locally on the device.

Nothing is uploaded.

docs.title: 2. No Cloud, No Servers
docs.text:
Nyroxis does not use: - Cloud processing - Telemetry - Remote logging - Online scanning - External data sources

This eliminates entire classes of privacy and attack risks.

docs.title: 3. Local AI (NyXIA)
docs.text:
NyXIA runs completely offline: - Behavioral detection - Anomaly scoring - Scenario generation

All computed directly from encrypted local events.

docs.title: 4. Secure Updates (Optional)
docs.text:
Nyroxis can receive updates: - Manually - Offline package installation

No forced cloud connections.

docs.title: 5. Transparent Architecture
docs.text:
Offline architecture avoids: - Background tracking - Invisible network calls - Cloud-based analytics

Users can verify that Nyroxis does not connect to the internet.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Offline Mode guarantees that Nyroxis remains: - Private - Encrypted - Autonomous - Fully local

A security platform designed to protect users without exposing their data.

docs.title: Security Model
docs.text: The Nyroxis Security Model ensures that all monitoring, AI analysis, and event storage operate under strict privacy-first and tamper-resistant principles. This model is designed for individuals, professionals, and executives who require trustworthy security without sacrificing privacy.

docs.title: Core Objectives
docs.text:
Nyroxis protects: - Data confidentiality - System integrity - User privacy - Local autonomy (no cloud dependency)

The result: enterprise-grade protection on a personal device.

docs.title: 1. End-to-End Local Encryption
docs.text:
All event data is: - Encrypted at the moment of capture - Stored only in encrypted form - Accessible only through secure read-paths - Never written to disk in plaintext

Encryption keys are: - Local - Dynamic - Never stored inside the app - Not transmitted externally

docs.title: 2. Tamper-Resistant Storage
docs.text:
Nyroxis integrates: - Integrity checks - Protected write paths - Hash-chained event blocks - Anti-tamper verification during read/write operations

This prevents attackers from altering logs or covering their tracks.

docs.title: 3. Private On-Device AI
docs.text:
NyXIA (the AI engine): - Runs fully offline - Processes encrypted event data - Generates detections and scenarios locally - Never sends logs to servers

Your data stays on your device, always.

docs.title: 4. Full Offline Operation
docs.text:
Nyroxis does not require: - Cloud processing - Online authentication - External APIs - Remote storage

This removes entire classes of privacy risks.

docs.title: 5. Minimal Data Retention
docs.text:
Nyroxis stores only: - Security events - Metadata needed for detection

It does not store: - Personal documents - User files - Browsing history - Credentials - Location data

Only what is necessary for security analysis.

docs.title: 6. Transparent Logic
docs.text:
The security model is intentionally simple: - Local collection - Local encryption - Local AI - Local alerts

Nothing hidden, no silent uploads, no telemetry.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Nyroxis provides a strong, privacy-focused security foundation: - Encrypted event storage - Tamper protection - Local-only AI - No cloud risks

A modern security model designed for people who value both privacy and protection.

docs.title: User Control & Transparency
docs.text: Nyroxis is designed to give users full control over their security data, system behavior, and privacy settings. No hidden processes, no background uploads, no cloud connections — everything is transparent and locally managed.

docs.title: Core Principles of User Control
docs.text:
Nyroxis ensures that users can: - See what is being monitored - Control what is stored - Reset or delete data at any time - Verify offline operation - Understand how AI decisions are made

The user always stays in charge.

docs.text:
Nyroxis collects only what is necessary for security analysis: - Logs of processes - Network events - File changes - Privilege actions

No personal files, photos, messages, or browsing data are ever collected.

Everything is explained clearly in the documentation.

docs.title: 2. Full Data Reset

Users can reset: - Logs - Metadata - AI behavioral baseline - Correlation cache

docs.title: 3. Local-Only Storage

Trust is measurable — not assumed.

Nyroxis provides a fully local, offline, privacy‑focused protection layer ideal for these environments.

docs.title: Architecture Components
docs.text: This section describes each core component of the Nyroxis platform and how they work together to deliver private, offline, tamper‑resistant security.

docs.title: 1. Nyroxis Agent (Event Collector)
docs.text:
The Agent is the lightweight background service responsible for: - Monitoring processes - Tracking network connections - Observing file changes - Watching privilege activity - Capturing system events in real time

All events are encrypted immediately before being written anywhere.

It is designed to be: - Silent - Efficient - Low‑resource - Fully offline

docs.title: 2. Secure Local Database
docs.text:
A protected, encrypted local storage that holds: - Event logs - Metadata - Behavioral baselines - Correlation indexes

Security features include: - AES‑based encryption - Integrity checking - Hash‑chained event blocks - No plaintext storage

The database never leaves the device.

docs.title: 3. NyXIA — Local AI Engine
docs.text:
NyXIA is the offline AI engine powering: - Behavioral anomaly detection - Scenario generation - Risk scoring - Sequence pattern analysis

It processes encrypted events locally and does not require: - Cloud AI - Telemetry - Network access

Privacy‑first by design.

docs.title: 4. Rule Matching Engine
docs.text:
A deterministic rule‑based engine used for: - Pattern detection - Event frequency checks - Threshold‑based alerts - Correlation support

It complements AI with predictable, transparent logic.

docs.title: 5. Dashboard (User Interface)
docs.text:
The Dashboard provides: - Real‑time visibility - Event search - AI insights - Charts & analytics - Settings and retention control

Everything displayed is retrieved locally from the secure database.

docs.title: 6. Security Layer
docs.text: Every component is protected by: - Local encryption - Integrity verification - No cloud communication - Strict offline operation - Tamper‑resistant data structures

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis components work as an integrated, private, offline ecosystem — providing strong security without exposing any user data to the cloud.

docs.title: High-Level Architecture
docs.text: The Nyroxis architecture is designed to provide strong security, full privacy, and complete offline autonomy. This high-level overview explains how all major components work together while keeping user data protected and encrypted locally.

docs.title: Core Architectural Principles
docs.text: Nyroxis is built upon four primary foundations:

docs.title: 1. Fully Local Operation
docs.text: All processing — logging, AI, analysis, storage — happens on the device.

docs.title: 2. Privacy by Design
docs.text: Nothing is uploaded to the cloud. No telemetry. No remote monitoring.

docs.title: 3. Lightweight & Efficient
docs.text: Designed to protect personal and professional devices without draining system resources.

docs.title: 4. Tamper-Resistant Security
docs.text: Event logs, metadata, and behavioral profiles are encrypted and integrity-protected.

docs.title: 1. Nyroxis Agent (Event Collector)
docs.text:
Responsible for: - Capturing system events - Encrypting records immediately - Storing logs locally - Monitoring processes, network, files, and privilege use

Runs quietly in the background with minimal resource usage.

docs.title: 2. Secure Local Database
docs.text:
Stores: - Encrypted event logs - Metadata for AI and correlations - Behavioral baselines

All data remains: - Encrypted - Local - Protected by integrity checks

docs.title: 3. NyXIA AI Engine (Local Offline AI)
docs.text:
Performs: - Behavioral anomaly detection - Scenario analysis - Risk scoring - Sequence evaluation - Local-only inference

It never sends data externally and never requires cloud connectivity.

docs.title: 4. Rule Matching Engine
docs.text:
Provides: - Pattern detection - Threshold-based alerts - Correlation logic - Scenario grouping

Designed to complement the AI engine, not replace it.

docs.title: 5. Dashboard (User Interface)
docs.text:
Displays: - Logs - Alerts - Scenarios - AI insights - Charts & analytics

Users can manage: - Settings - Retention - Reset options - Alert thresholds

All interactions remain local.

docs.title: Security Layers
docs.text:
The architecture includes multiple defensive layers:

  • Encryption at capture
  • Local secure storage
  • Hash-chained event structures
  • Offline AI
  • Tamper detection
  • No external communication

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis architecture delivers powerful, private, offline security by combining the Agent, AI Engine, secure local storage, and a transparent dashboard — all working together without cloud exposure.

docs.title: Data Flow — High-Level Overview
docs.text: This section explains how data moves inside Nyroxis — from event collection to AI analysis — while remaining fully encrypted, offline, and private at every step.

docs.title: 1. Event Capture (Nyroxis Agent)
docs.text:
The flow begins with the Agent monitoring: - Processes - Network events - File system operations - Privilege actions

Every event is captured in real time.

Immediately after capture: - The event is serialized - Encrypted using the device’s local key - Prepared for storage

No plaintext ever touches the disk.

docs.title: 2. Encrypted Storage (Local Database)
docs.text:
Once encrypted, events are written into: - The secure local database - Hash‑chained event structures - Protected write paths

Each entry includes: - Timestamp - Encrypted payload - Integrity hash - Metadata required for AI

All data stays on the user’s device — never synced or uploaded.

docs.title: 3. Local AI Processing (NyXIA)
docs.text:
NyXIA periodically reads events from the database: - Still encrypted at rest - Decrypted only in memory - Processed inside a secure local runtime

NyXIA performs: - Behavioral feature extraction - Sequence grouping - Anomaly scoring - Scenario evaluation

No part of the AI requires cloud access.

docs.title: ️ 4. Rule Matching Engine
docs.text:
In parallel, the rule engine analyzes: - Event frequency - Threshold violations - Pattern matches - Correlation hints

It complements AI with deterministic logic.

docs.title: 5. Dashboard Display (Local UI)
docs.text:
The Dashboard pulls only: - Decrypted-in-memory summaries - Processed AI results - Correlation outputs - Alerts

All UI rendering happens locally, with no external communication.

docs.title: 6. Optional User Actions
docs.text:
Users may: - Search encrypted logs (decrypted in memory) - Clear/reset data - Adjust thresholds - Export encrypted backups (future feature)

All options stay local and private.

docs.title: Privacy by Architecture
docs.text:
Every step ensures: - No cloud use - No telemetry - No remote access - No online dependencies

Nyroxis maintains full privacy through architecture — not just configuration.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis data flow is simple, private, and fully offline: 1. Event captured → encrypted 2. Stored securely → integrity-protected 3. Analyzed locally → AI + rules 4. Displayed locally → dashboard 5. No cloud, no upload, no exposure

docs.title: Encryption Model
docs.text:
Nyroxis implements a strict, multi‑layered encryption model designed to ensure that no readable data ever touches disk, and that all security events remain protected, private, and verifiable.

This page describes how encryption is applied across the entire platform.

docs.title: Core Goals of the Encryption Model
docs.text:
Nyroxis encryption is designed to achieve:

  • Confidentiality — no one can read user data
  • Integrity — no one can modify logs undetected
  • Isolation — data never leaves the device
  • Zero plaintext storage — everything encrypted at capture
  • Offline operation — no need for cloud keys or servers

docs.title: 1. Encryption at Event Capture
docs.text:
Every system event is encrypted the moment it is collected by the Agent.

Steps: 1. Event is serialized in memory 2. A device‑specific key is loaded 3. The event is encrypted with AES‑based encryption 4. Only the encrypted block is written to storage

No plaintext logs are ever written.

docs.title: 2. Encrypted Local Database
docs.text:
All logs and metadata are stored inside a secure encrypted database.

Features include: - AES‑encrypted data pages - Encrypted metadata - Hash‑chained storage blocks - Per‑record integrity verification - No plaintext caching

The database cannot be opened or read outside Nyroxis.

docs.title: 3. In‑Memory Decryption Only (AI & Dashboard)
docs.text:
Nyroxis decrypts records only while processing them:

  • NyXIA decrypts event batches in RAM
  • Dashboard decrypts only what it needs to display summaries
  • Nothing is written back in plaintext
  • Memory buffers are securely cleared

This eliminates risk of forensic recovery.

docs.title: 4. Device‑Bound Keys
docs.text:
Encryption keys are tied to the user’s machine using: - Hardware identifiers - Local derivation - Salted hashing - Split secrets

Keys are never stored directly and never transmitted.

Even if the database is copied, it cannot be decrypted elsewhere.

docs.title: 5. Integrity Protection
docs.text:
Each encrypted block contains: - Integrity hash - Event sequence marker - Tamper flag - Link to the previous block

This forms a hash‑chain that exposes: - Log deletion - Log modification - Log reordering - Log injection

Tampering becomes immediately detectable.

docs.title: 6. No Cloud Involvement
docs.text:
Nyroxis does not use: - Cloud key vaults - Remote servers - Online activation - Telemetry systems

All encryption, key derivation, and verification are local.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Nyroxis encryption ensures: - Zero plaintext - Encrypted‑everywhere design - Local‑only keys - Tamper‑resistant logs - Privacy‑preserving AI

A modern encryption model built for personal security and full offline autonomy.

docs.title: Local AI (NyXIA)
docs.text:
NyXIA is the fully local, offline AI engine inside Nyroxis. It performs all behavioral analysis, anomaly detection, and scenario generation without sending any data to the cloud.

This section explains how the AI works and how privacy is preserved.

docs.title: 1. Fully Offline AI Engine
docs.text:
NyXIA runs entirely on the device: - No server communication - No online model updates - No telemetry - No external dependencies

All inference and processing are isolated within the local runtime.

docs.title: 2. Behavioral Sequence Analysis
docs.text:
NyXIA analyzes events not individually but as short behavioral sequences, allowing it to detect: - Multi-step attacks - Slow malicious behavior - Unusual workflow patterns - Suspicious privilege actions - Combined signals across multiple event types

This provides more accurate and realistic detection.

docs.title: 3. Anomaly Scoring
docs.text:
Every behavioral sequence receives: - A behavioral embedding - A deviation score - A risk classification - An explanation summary

The system highlights why something is suspicious — transparent and local.

docs.title: 4. Local Behavioral Baselines
docs.text:
Each device builds its own baseline profile: - Normal process activity - Normal network patterns - Typical user interactions - File access patterns

These baselines never leave the device and are not shared with anyone.

docs.title: 5. Scenario Generation
docs.text:
NyXIA groups related events to build meaningful scenarios: - Suspicious process chains - Abnormal network bursts - File access anomalies - Privilege escalation attempts - Persistence indicators

Each scenario has: - Description - Severity - Evidence list - Timestamp

All generated locally.

docs.title: 6. No Cloud Training or Uploading
docs.text:
NyXIA does not upload: - Logs - Anomaly samples - Behavioral profiles - Model feedback - Any user data

Training and inference are exclusively offline.

docs.title: 7. Lightweight and Resource-Efficient
docs.text:
Optimized for: - Personal laptops - Executive devices - Freelancers - Air‑gapped systems

NyXIA provides enterprise-level AI detection without enterprise hardware.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
NyXIA ensures: - Local-only AI - No cloud dependency - Full privacy - Strong behavioral detection - Transparent, explainable results

A modern AI engine built for private cybersecurity.

docs.title: Offline Security
docs.text: Nyroxis is designed to operate fully offline without any dependency on cloud services, external APIs, or remote servers. This ensures complete autonomy, privacy, and protection even in disconnected environments.

docs.title: 1. No Cloud Communication
docs.text:
Nyroxis never: - Sends telemetry - Syncs logs - Contacts remote servers - Uses cloud AI - Requires online activation

Every function is local.

docs.title: 2. Local-Only Key Management
docs.text:
Encryption keys are: - Generated locally - Bound to device hardware - Never transmitted - Never stored in plaintext - Reconstructed only when needed

All crypto happens offline.

docs.title: 3. Offline AI (NyXIA)
docs.text:
NyXIA provides: - Behavioral detection - Sequence analysis - Anomaly scoring - Scenario generation

All without cloud inference or cloud training.

docs.title: 4. Local Encrypted Storage
docs.text:
All event logs and metadata remain: - Fully encrypted - Stored in a protected database - Accessible only on the same device

No risk of remote breaches or cloud leaks.

docs.title: 5. No External Fetching
docs.text:
Nyroxis does not download: - Rules - Models - Signatures - Threat intel

Everything is embedded locally.

docs.title: 6. Works in Air‑Gapped Environments
docs.text:
Nyroxis runs perfectly on: - Offline laptops - Isolated corporate environments - Sensitive government setups - High-risk locations with no internet

Full functionality requires zero connectivity.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Nyroxis offline security ensures: - Full autonomy - Zero cloud exposure - Local-only AI - Private encrypted storage - Complete independence

A security model built for maximum privacy and control.

docs.title: Security Overview
docs.text:
Nyroxis is built with a strict security-first philosophy: all operations are local, encrypted, tamper-resistant, and designed to protect the user without exposing any data to third parties.

This overview summarizes the main security principles and mechanisms used across the platform.

docs.title: 1. Privacy by Design
docs.text: Nyroxis does not upload, sync, or transmit any data to servers. All security logic, monitoring, and AI analysis run entirely on the device.

docs.title: 2. Encryption Everywhere
docs.text:
Every captured event is: - Encrypted instantly - Stored only in encrypted form - Decrypted exclusively in memory - Protected with integrity hashes

No plaintext logs ever exist on disk.

docs.title: 3. Zero Cloud Dependency
docs.text:
Nyroxis does not rely on: - Cloud storage - External APIs - Remote servers - Telemetry pipelines

Users maintain full autonomy and zero external exposure.

docs.title: 4. Offline AI (NyXIA)
docs.text:
The AI engine processes data locally: - Behavioral detection - Anomaly scoring - Scenario evaluation

No cloud training, no cloud inference.

docs.title: 1. Secure Event Capture
docs.text:
The agent captures: - Processes - Files - Network - Privilege actions

All events are encrypted immediately.

docs.title: 2. Tamper-Resistant Storage
docs.text:
The local database includes: - AES encryption - Hash-chained blocks - Protected write paths - Integrity checks

Attackers cannot modify logs without detection.

docs.title: 3. Local Behavioral Baselines
docs.text:
Nyroxis builds: - Per-device profiles - Local activity patterns - Secure baselines

Used to detect anomalies without exposing user habits to the cloud.

docs.title: 4. Rule Matching Layer
docs.text:
Provides: - Threshold-based alerts - Pattern detection - Correlation cues

All rule logic runs locally.

docs.title: 5. Dashboard Security
docs.text: The UI: - Reads decrypted summaries only in RAM - Never exposes raw logs - Does not connect to external sources

docs.title: Security Layers Summary
docs.text: Nyroxis integrates multiple defensive layers: - Local encryption - Local AI - Offline operation - Secure storage - Integrity verification - Zero cloud exposure - Privacy-first architecture

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: Nyroxis provides a modern, private, offline security model that protects users without tracking them — combining transparency, control, and strong defensive design.

docs.title: Tamper Protection
docs.text: Nyroxis includes strong tamper‑protection mechanisms designed to ensure that no attacker can delete, modify, forge, or reorder logs without detection. These protections operate fully offline and are enforced inside the local database and event pipeline.

docs.title: 1. Hash‑Chained Event Blocks
docs.text:
Each event is stored as: - Encrypted payload - Integrity hash - Sequential index - Link to previous block

This structure forms a hash‑chain similar to a blockchain.

Tampering becomes visible if: - A block is removed - A block is modified - A block is injected - The sequence is reordered

Any mismatch breaks the chain and is flagged immediately.

docs.title: 2. Integrity Verification at Read Time
docs.text:
Every time NyXIA or the Dashboard reads data: - Hash is recalculated - Sequence number is checked - Previous‑hash match is validated

If anything has been altered, the system: - Rejects the data - Flags a tamper event - Stores a security alert locally

All checks remain local and offline.

docs.title: 3. Protected Write Path
docs.text:
The Agent writes logs using: - Atomic operations - Controlled file handles - Verified write sequences - Encrypted buffers

This prevents: - Partial writes - Interrupted corruption - Injection attacks - Unverified metadata

docs.title: 4. Anti‑Deletion Protection
docs.text:
If an attacker deletes logs: - The next block’s previous-hash will not match - Nyroxis will detect a gap - A “tamper‑deletion” alert is generated

Nothing can be removed silently.

docs.title: 5. Anti‑Modification Protection
docs.text:
If an attacker modifies: - Timestamp - Metadata - Event content - Block ordering

Nyroxis detects it through: - Hash mismatch - Index inconsistency - Chain breakage

Modification is impossible without detection.

docs.title: 6. Anti‑Injection Protection
docs.text:
If someone tries to insert fake logs: - Sequence numbers fail - Hash chain fails - Integrity check fails

Nyroxis rejects the entire data slice and warns the user.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Nyroxis tamper protection ensures: - Logs cannot be deleted - Logs cannot be modified - Logs cannot be injected - Logs cannot be reordered - Any tampering is detectable

All protections operate locally, offline, and without cloud assistance.

docs.title: ❓ Is Nyroxis fully offline?
docs.text: Yes. No cloud, no telemetry, no data transmission.

docs.text: No. It only analyzes technical security events.

docs.text: Only encrypted backups (future feature).

docs.text: 100% local — no cloud inference.

docs.title: Qu’est-ce que Nyroxis ?
docs.text:
Nyroxis est une plateforme de cybersécurité légère et assistée par IA conçue pour protéger les terminaux personnels et non gérés.

Elle fournit une surveillance locale continue et respectueuse de la vie privée, afin d’identifier toute activité suspecte sans dépendre du cloud ni nécessiter de compétences techniques.

docs.title: Pourquoi Nyroxis existe
docs.text:
Les cyberattaques ciblent aujourd’hui les individus via leurs appareils personnels, sans SOC ni SIEM.

Nyroxis apporte une visibilité de niveau entreprise au quotidien — sans complexité.

docs.title: À qui s’adresse Nyroxis ?
docs.text:
• Cadres et personnes à haut profil
  • Avocats, médecins et professions sensibles
  • Familles cherchant une meilleure visibilité
  • Ingénieurs cybersécurité & analystes SOC
  • Voyageurs fréquents et télétravailleurs

  • Fonctionnement hors-ligne
  • Résistant à la falsification

docs.title: Fonctionnalités clés
docs.text: Nyroxis apporte une visibilité de niveau entreprise aux appareils personnels et professionnels, tout en restant léger, privé et entièrement fonctionnel hors‑ligne.

docs.title: Surveillance locale des événements
docs.text:
Nyroxis collecte en continu les activités importantes : - Création / arrêt de processus - Connexions réseau - Modifications de fichiers - Actions liées aux privilèges - Événements système et sécurité

Toute la surveillance est locale, sans envoi vers le cloud.

docs.title: Stockage local chiffré
docs.text:
Tous les événements sont : - Chiffrés au repos - Protégés contre la falsification - Stockés uniquement sur l’appareil de l’utilisateur

Nyroxis garantit que les journaux restent privés et sous contrôle de l’utilisateur.

docs.title: Analyse comportementale assistée par IA
docs.text:
Nyroxis utilise des modèles IA légers pour identifier : - Comportements suspects - Séquences d’activités anormales - Signes précoces de compromission - Mécanismes potentiels de persistance

L’IA aide à réduire le bruit et à mettre en avant l’essentiel.

docs.title: Tableau de bord clair et accessible
docs.text:
Le dashboard fournit : - Une timeline d’événements - Graphiques et résumés visuels - Indicateurs de sévérité - Explications simples des actions suspectes

Conçu pour les non‑techniciens comme pour les experts cybersécurité.

docs.title: Architecture résistante à la falsification
docs.text:
Nyroxis protège : - Le service Agent - Les journaux locaux - L’intégrité des données collectées

Rendant difficile l’effacement de traces par un attaquant.

docs.title: Utilisation hors‑ligne
docs.text:
Nyroxis fonctionne sans : - Connexion cloud - Dépendance Internet - Authentification externe

La plateforme convient aux environnements à haute exigence de confidentialité.

docs.title: Conçu pour les utilisateurs réels
docs.text:
Nyroxis est adapté aux : - Postes de cadres - Ordinateurs d’avocats / médecins - Ordinateurs familiaux - Home labs cybersécurité - Ordinateurs de télétravail

Il apporte clarté et contrôle sans complexité.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Nyroxis est une plateforme de cybersécurité légère et centrée sur la vie privée, offrant aux individus et aux professionnels un niveau de visibilité proche des environnements d’entreprise — sans complexité, sans coût élevé et sans dépendance au cloud.

Dans la vie numérique moderne, les terminaux personnels et non gérés sont devenus le maillon faible. Ordinateurs portables à domicile, postes personnels et appareils du quotidien contiennent des données sensibles, mais n’ont aucune surveillance structurée.

Nyroxis apporte une réponse simple : une intelligence de sécurité locale, directement sur l’appareil, avec un stockage chiffré et une analyse assistée par IA.

docs.title: Le problème que Nyroxis résout
docs.text:
Les organisations disposent d’équipes SOC, de SIEM et de surveillance continue — mais les particuliers et petits environnements professionnels, non.

Cela crée un écart critique : - Aucune visibilité sur les processus ou connexions - Aucune alerte en cas d’activité suspecte - Impossible de savoir si le système est visé - Aucun historique de sécurité structuré

Nyroxis comble cet écart avec une couche de sécurité intelligente, locale et claire.

docs.title: Notre approche
docs.text:
Nyroxis repose sur trois principes : - Sécurité locale avant tout — toutes les données restent sur l’appareil - Détection intelligente — analyse comportementale et IA - Visibilité accessible — tableaux clairs et explications simples

Le résultat : une solution adaptée aux familles, professionnels, cadres et experts cybersécurité.

docs.text:

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Présentation simple de Nyroxis, de sa raison d’être et de la manière dont il apporte une visibilité de niveau entreprise aux appareils personnels et professionnels.

docs.title: Problème & Contexte
docs.text: Analyse du manque croissant de cybersécurité personnelle : - Hausse des attaques sur les appareils personnels - Manque de visibilité pour les particuliers et petits professionnels - Pourquoi les outils classiques ne suffisent plus

docs.title: Vision
docs.text: La mission long‑terme de Nyroxis : - Privacy‑first - Intelligence compréhensible - Visibilité entreprise pour tous - Un futur sans angles morts personnels

docs.title: Proposition de valeur
docs.text: En quoi Nyroxis se distingue : - Surveillance locale - Chiffrement complet - Analyse comportementale IA - Conçu pour familles, pros et experts - Insights clairs, sans complexité

docs.title: Fonctionnalités clés
docs.text: Les principales capacités de Nyroxis : - Surveillance locale - Stockage chiffré - IA comportementale - Dashboard clair - Fonctionnement hors‑ligne

docs.title: Résumé
docs.text: Cette section constitue la base pour comprendre Nyroxis. Vous pouvez maintenant continuer vers : ➡ Architecture ➡ Agent ➡ Dashboard ➡ Sécurité & Confidentialité

docs.title: Personas cibles
docs.text: Nyroxis est conçu pour des utilisateurs réels ayant besoin d’une protection plus avancée que celle des outils classiques grand public. Voici les principaux profils concernés.

docs.title: Cadres & personnes à haut profil
docs.text:
Ces utilisateurs sont souvent ciblés par : - Vol d’identifiants - Ingénierie sociale - Malware ciblé - Tentatives de surveillance

Nyroxis leur fournit une visibilité locale sans dépendre du cloud.

docs.title: Avocats, médecins & professions sensibles
docs.text:
Ces professionnels gèrent des données extrêmement confidentielles et ont besoin de : - Forte confidentialité - Journaux résistants à la falsification - Détection précoce des anomalies
